key_title: Key to the species of Pteris

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Pteridaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fronds once pinnate or irregularly 2-pinnate at base, rarely pedately divided
Pinnae undivided and shortly stalked; stipe short and densely covered with fine pale scales and hairs
Basal pinnae divided; undivided pinnae and pinnae-segments decurrent, forming wing on rachis; stipe very long and almost bare
Fronds 100–250 cm long; only lowermost pinnae 2-pinnate, segments usually more than 5 mm wide
Fronds 5–45 cm long; lowermost pinnae pedatly divided, pinnae 1 or 2-pinnate distally, lowermost pinnae segments usually less than 5 mm wide
Lamina dark green; leaflets with some veins forming areoles near midvein
Lamina light green; veins (except for soral vein) free
